objects.title: What’s new with the 511.org website?
objects.content: 511 is excited to announce the NEW 511.org website launching in June. Plan your trip, get real-time transit departures and driving times, check current conditions, and more – all from your smartphone, tablet, laptop, or desktop computer.

objects.title: What if I want more information?
objects.content: Click here to use the 511 suggestions form. We appreciate your feedback and comments.

objects.title: What new features and tools have been added?
objects.content:
The new 511.org is now easier to navigate. Desktop users will notice the main navigation tabs have moved from the top of the screen to the left side. We’ve simplified the navigation to connect travelers to the content they access most often. Click on any of the icons to find the information you’re looking for. 

We’ve updated the previous transit trip planner with a multimodal trip planner that will allow users to switch between driving, transit, bicycling, and walking itineraries to compare trip options. Use the interactive map to find the latest traffic conditions and view traffic cameras, HOV and toll information, transit center locations, Bay Area Bike Share locations, and more. 

We’ve also added a “For Employers” section that provides information on the Bay Area Commuter Benefits Program and features case studies and resources for implementing workplace trip reduction strategies.

objects.title: Why make changes to 511.org?
objects.content: This major update to 511 is designed to improve the customer experience and provide easy access to Bay Area travel information for mobile, desktop, and telephone users.

objects.title: How can I get real-time traffic updates?
objects.content:
The new 511.org features a real-time map of traffic and alerts on the home page. Check it any time to see real-time traffic conditions and special alerts for your route. Or, you can call 511 to hear Driving Times for your route or Traffic Conditions for a city, highway, bridge, or hotspot.

Be safe! Please check traffic conditions before you leave, call 511 for voice-activated travel information, or pull over to check your smartphone for updates.

objects.title: How can I get real-time transit updates?
objects.content: You can always call 511 and say “Departure Times,” or use the tool on the 511.org home page, for up-to-the-minute transit departure times. The interactive 511 trip planner allows for easy trip planning and system alerts. 511 Transit Tracker tool allows you to customize your stops on your smartphone, tablet, or desktop computer and see real-time departure information any time you need it.

objects.title: Is MY 511 changing?
objects.content: Yes. MY 511 will be discontinued both on the web and on the phone. Email/text alerts will end in June 2016. The new, mobile-friendly 511.org will replace MY 511. You’ll be able to access the same, trusted, real-time travel information whenever you need it, wherever you are, on your favorite device.

objects.title: This is a staging site FAQ question?
objects.content: Yes. It is. This is the answer,

objects.title: Can I still call 511 from my phone?
objects.content: Yes. 511 is fully automated and will help you get the information you need through simple voice commands. Just follow the voice prompts for real-time transit departures, driving times, traffic conditions, carpooling, vanpooling, parking, and transfers to transit agencies, Clipper, FasTrak, and Freeway Assist.

objects.title: Can I use the new 511.org on my smartphone or tablet?
objects.content: Yes. 511.org is now fully mobile compatible. With the new 511, simply bookmark 511.org or save it to your smartphone or tablet home screen. You can bookmark the 511.org home page or the pages you use most often. Please use 511.org safely. If you need to check traffic conditions or plan a trip while driving, call 511 and use voice commands or pull over to check your phone.

objects.title: How do I bookmark 511.org on my smartphone, tablet or desktop?
objects.content: Create your own app-like button for 511.org or bookmark your favorite pages using your device’s “add to home screen/desktop” or “bookmark” feature. (This feature may vary by device.)

objects.title: Have any features or tools been discontinued?
objects.content:
Live 511 operator service has been discontinued as of June 30, 2016. See “Can I still call 511 from my phone” for more information.

The SchoolPool matching tool has been discontinued as of June 30, 2016.

objects.title: What new features and tools have been added?
objects.content:
The new 511.org is now easier to navigate. Desktop users will notice the main navigation tabs have moved from the top of the screen to the left side. We’ve simplified the navigation to connect travelers to the content they access most often. Click on any of the icons to find the information you’re looking for.

We’ve updated the previous transit trip planner with a multimodal trip planner that will allow users to switch between driving, transit, bicycling, and walking itineraries to compare trip options. Use the interactive map to find the latest traffic conditions and view traffic cameras, HOV and toll information, transit center locations, Bay Area Bike Share locations, and more.

We’ve also added a “For Employers” section that provides information on the Bay Area Commuter Benefits Program and features case studies and resources for implementing workplace trip reduction strategies.
